Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a brown pottery jar, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey in section, the interior is partially covered with traces of a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is elaborated with polychrome (red, brown, blue and black) painted decoration, comprising repeated floral motifs and horizontal bands, one of which contains one line of black-painted hieratic text identifying the sometime contents as firm fine linen.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393513) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393513)
